intro: Selago longithyrsus, commonly known as the long-thyrse selago, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound umbels of small white flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Selago longithyrsus thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
